summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between FBI agents and other personnel discussing the progress of a 'taint review' of electronic devices related to the Jeffrey Epstein (JE) investigation. The emails coordinate the review of a Mac computer and search terms, indicating an ongoing post-conviction evidence processing effort.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The primary FBI agent from the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, coordinating the taint review project and checking on progress.

persons.name: Steve
persons.context: Mentioned as being available to answer questions for the review team during the FBI agent's absence.

persons.name: Det.
persons.role: Detective, partner to the FBI agent
persons.context: The FBI agent's partner who sits nearby and is noted as being available to answer questions for the review team.

connections.description: Described as partners who sit next to each other, both involved in the Epstein taint review coordination.
Steve is noted as another point of contact available to answer questions for the review team alongside the agent.

events.title: Taint Review Search Terms Distributed
events.description: The FBI Special Agent distributes search terms for the Jeffrey Epstein taint review to the team, noting they will be out the following week.

events.title: Taint Review Progress Update
events.description: A team member provides an update that the review project is going well, though some search terms have yielded over 10,000 hits, taking longer than anticipated.

events.title: FBI Check-in on Review Progress
events.description: The FBI Special Agent checks in on the status of the taint review, asking for updates on completed devices and remaining work.

events.title: Mac Review Progress Report
events.description: A team member reports they are about halfway done with the review of a Mac computer and will continue working on it in the office.

keyFacts: The FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit was conducting a 'taint review' of electronic evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein (JE) in 2020.
The review involved specific search terms (documented in 'Epstein Priv terms.docx') applied to devices, including a Mac computer.
Some search terms generated over 10,000 hits, indicating a large volume of potentially relevant data was being processed.
The email chain shows ongoing coordination and progress tracking of this forensic review well after Epstein's 2019 death.
